question: FADE IN:
answer: Once we lived in an enchanted world. . . A world of Tsars and Princesses and elegant palaces. . . and grand parties. . . A beautiful, magical time. . . That would soon be gone forever. . .

question: Don't worry, Sonya, no one'll notice. . . . . . owwwwwwwww!
answer: Why were you so late tonight

question: I was showing Sonya something . . .
answer: What were you showing her?

question: How to read.
answer: I thought you were told not to tutor your servants anymore.

question: I know, but I had to because . . . Oh, Grandmama, why do you have to go back to Paris?
answer: It's where I've made my home but I do have something for you . . .

question: "Together in Paris"! Oh, when can we be "together in Paris?!
answer: When you're older . . . Until then, whenever you hear this song, think of me and know that I'm waiting for you.

question: No, no, Comrade - you don't want her . . .
answer: I want her.

question: That's horrible, skinny thing?! She's crazy - she has no memory of anything before she came here! She didn't even know her name! That one is a rotten troublemaker, willful. . .
answer: I'll break her will. . . I shall come for you tomorrow at dawn. You will enjoy serving under me.

question: Anya? Are you running away?
answer: No. I'm running to. To find my home. No. This isn't a home - it's just a building. Home is where you belong and none of us belong here.

question: Where is your home, Anya?
answer: I'm not sure but look. . . It says "Together in Paris". I was wearing this when I came here ten years ago - it's the only way that I know . . . . . . that I must have been someone someone loved. It might be. I have to go and find out. I have to go now, before it gets light.

question: But what if we can't ever find where we came from?!
answer: Then you'll have to make your own home. Lots of people do.

question: Anya! What if we can't find anyone who loves us?!
answer: Then come find me. I hope there's no snow in Paris. . . I think you should be more careful about who you invite to dinner! Could someone tell me. . . Which line?

question: Dmitri! I can not work with her! May I remind you that you are supposed to be Princess - not a lazy lumbering lout!
answer: Vladimir, calm down!

question: This, my friend, as an exercise in futility! We shall never find a girl to play the Princess Anastasia out of this motley crew of commoners!
answer: For a ten million rubles reward we can look a little longer. This is the big one. . . and all I need is the right girl. Next! Next! Next! I wouldn't be on the outside anymore. The ten million rubles would make me welcome anywhere. I'd really belong somewhere - if I could just find the right girl. Next!

question: Stanislavski!
answer: Next! I've gotta find the right girl! Next.

question: It's no use, Dmitri - we'll never find the right girl!
answer: We will. We have to. Come on, Vlad - she's out there. She could be right under our nose Ouch! That really hurt!

question: I'm looking for Dmitri. I need traveling papers - to Paris. I heard Dmitri could help me.
answer: Who did you hear it from?

question: I heard it from everyone who said I didn't hear it from them! Do you know Dmitri?
answer: Providing travel papers is illeagal! I know Dmitri well - perhaps I can help you. Providded you have enough money to pay for this service. . .

question: Well, I don't have any money . . .
answer: Good day!

question: You look like her. Like the Princess Anastasia. Has anyone ever told you that before?
answer: Oh, yeah - in the orphanage they constantly told me I looked like a princess! Stop that!

question: People say Anastasia was the only member of the Royal Family to escape alive. That makes her an orphan too What happened to your parents?
answer: I don't know - I don't remember anything that happened before the revolution. . .

question: You know, it's strange - Anastasia's grandmother, the Dowager Empress Tatiana has been looking for Anastasia since the revolution. Why do you think she wouldn't go to her own grandmother?
answer: I don't know. I don't see what this has to do with me.

question: Look, I came here to get papers to travel to Paris and. . .
answer: Why do you want to go to Paris?

question: I have my reasons.
answer: Anastasia's grandmother is in Paris. We're going to bring Anastasia to her - in Paris. And I think you are the Princess Anastasia. You never thought of the possibility?

question: Look - there isn't an orphan in the world who doesn't dream she's a princess but, come on. . . Look at me!
answer: NO! YOU LOOK AT HER! LOOK AT HER! It could be you. You don't have anything to lose. If I am wrong - the Empress will simply tell us you aren't Anastasia and we'll be on our way. No harm done - an honest mistake - but at least you will be in Paris. Find out the truth - come to Paris with us.

question: All right. I will go with you.
answer: The Her Royal Highness Princess Anastasia!

question: Oy. . . he's gonna be so mad... Ummm ... Father Gregori? It's, uhh ... me. Bartok. Phew! Not home ...
answer: What?

question: Oh my God! Don't do that ... feel my heart. Go ahead. I'm dying here ...
answer: And what do you want, my little rat-with-wings?

question: Name calling! That's mature.
answer: I gave you that tongue and I can rip it out!

question: No, I really like my tongue... we're very attached. Oyyyy... Okay, now... promise you won't get angry.
answer: Why would I ever be angry with you, little friend?

question: Yeah, right. Keep that thought okay? So, I'm in town, stop by the old palace. You get a better class of bats there - no tattoos or anything. So, I'm cruisin' the rafters and... what can I say, I struck out. I thought chicks would like the fact that I can talk, you know but, I mean, the way things are going I couldn't get invited to a plague. Someone's gotta clean that up...
answer: Get to the point sometime tonight.. I'm late for a wenching.

question: Okay... you're not gonna like this but, well, it looks like Anastasia is ... still alive.
answer: Impossible. That rumor's been around for years.

question: Trust me, it's her!
answer: How do you know?

question: Rodent's intuition, how do I know? She looks exactly like her. Except she's taller, which is natural ... Of course my second cousin Treplev - he never grew. Looks like a little pepper shaker. He was so cute ... Oyyy... I knew this was gonna to upset him!
answer: Source of my power. Owner of my soul. I need your help.

question: Hey, she's just a kid. And she's going to Paris outta sight, outta mind, outta Russia.
answer: I cursed then all!

question: My Aunt Bella, sweet woman not the brightest bat in the world - she used to hang right side up, anyway she always said "Curses were made to be broken". Course, she said it in those irritating little bat squeaks, so it wasn't quite so profound...
answer: The Romanovs tried to kill me and I swore to destroy all of them! If she lives, if she should have a child someday, the Romanov Family continues! And I won't lot that happen! THIS IS THE END OF THE LINE!

question: You know, this is really obsessive behavior. There is this doctor this doctor in Austria, Sigmund something and he feels. . .
answer: Yesses - you'd all like to get out, wouldn' t you? Sorry just one at a time and only when I call. Do you have any idea what would happen if that broke?!

question: You'd lose your security deposit?
answer: Evil, powerful beings - I have their power only if I contain them, control them. If they should all be released at once... well ... Where is she? Where is Princess Anastasia... She has friends. No matter...

question: Ohhh, that was dumb... Hello, I've get really terrible claustrophobia. That's why I could never live in a cave ...
answer: Finish my prophecy...

question: Ew, I hate when he does this!
answer: She is not to get off that train... alive! Go! I don't care what you do with the others but finish the girl! KILLLLL HERRRRR! And have fun...

question: Hurry up with those papers.
answer: Would you have leaned over Rembrant's shoulder and told him to paint faster? You probably would. They're still wet. Wake up, young lady, that's our train.

question: "Wake up, your highness" - we should start getting used to saying it.
answer: What a world - a man who was in my position in society is calling a peasant 'Your Highness".

question: Wake up! Come on! Take my hand! Do you always punch people first thing in the morning?
answer: Sorry - it's a reflex. Living in an orphanage if someone bothers you - you automatically come up swinging.

question: I wasn't bothering you. I was trying to wake you up!
answer: By pulling my hair?!

question: I was all out of dynamite!
answer: Put it on your nose. For heaven's sake, you're making such a fuss! Men are such babies... Here, let me

question: Wait here!
answer: Would you like to tell what we are...

question: Come on up!
answer: Why? Just what do you think you're doing?!

question: Trying... to... breathe... The guards! I'll explain later.
answer: Forged papers! Now, what?!

question: Now just get off the train.
answer: HUH?! Noooo....

question: Well, I better got goin'. Got a busy day letting all the blood rush to my head...
answer: She's too far away, isn't she? Yesss... our power is much stronger when were near. We must get close to her.

question: Oy... not a road trip. I get wagon sick, you know that. You're absolutely right. Travel broadens your horizons...
answer: We'll catch her and finish her! We ride this night!

question: Oh, yes it was the seagoing vessel of elaborate elegance in entertaining... A party boat. It once belonged to ...
answer: Konstantin Petrovich of Moscow!

question: Come out! I can do alterations.
answer: You'll laugh.

question: I shant!
answer: Not you. Him.

question: Not you. Him.
answer: I won't laugh - I swear...

question: You said you wouldn't laugh!
answer: It's not you - it's the dress!

question: I wanted to show you something.
answer: It's so beautiful ... and sad.

question: Sad?
answer: Lost. it feels lost. This was hers?

question: Yeah ... well, yours. You still don't believe that you're the Princess, do you?
answer: I know I must have had something to do with the palace - I've had little flashes of things - but being the Princess? It doesn't matter as long as I find my home.

question: Well, the only thing you've got when you've got a home is a fear of losing it! You're lucky you don't remember the revolution -- I never had much, but what I did have -- I lost.
answer: I'm sorry.

question: She's out there ...
answer: I'm getting a chest cold..

question: Bartok... a question.
answer: I'm getting pneumonia. I have a fever. Feel my forehead...

question: What do you think is the most humiliating way to die?
answer: My cousin Mischa, nice fellow had some dental problems - you didn't want to watch him eat, let's put it that way... ... anyway, a bunch of other bats were hanging in the belfry - I know, cliche, but there you have it, and Mischa, not the brightest bat in the world, decides to hang in the bell. Which was fine for awhile until it started ringing ... Ewwww, what a mess ... And it didn't help the tonal quality of the bell, either.

question: Boy, don't you hate it when that happens?
answer: She leads a charmed life, that little one ... Someone is always there to save her. In the palace as a child, on the train and now ... it's him.

question: Nice looking fellow. I mean, don't get me wrong - I'm not attracted to him in the physical sense, I just ...
answer: You are toying with me, aren't you? You let me get so close... Bartok ... have you ever been to Paris?

question: Me? No. Rich food - it kills me. Ever try and fly after one of those heavy sauces?
answer: We are going to Paris - and while we're there, let's kill the young man. He annoys me.

question: Oh good! We haven't seen an Anastasia in several days! I'd just like to ask you a few questions, dear...
answer: Of course.

question: Where were you born? This is the hard one ... what rare treat was served on the night of the Three Hundredth Anniversary of the Romanov Dynasty? The last ball they ever had?
answer: Father had fresh tropical fruits sent in. Oranges and pineapples from the far east. I remember ... I remember I threw an orange to a young boy who was hiding under a table...

question: Are you impressed with our Anastasia?
answer: Oh, heavens - I must say, yes.

question: Then, you'll take her to see Tatiana?
answer: Oh, heavens I must say... no, no actually, I can't - Tatiana has refused to see any more girls.

question: Perhaps you could convince her?
answer: Oh, heavens, no... but ... She is going to be at the Ballet Russe tonight! That's the Russian Ballet - Russe for Russian, oh those crazy French... they only go to see which dancers will defect. Come my dear, we've much to talk about.

question: She's so beautiful! I do remember her ... I remember her ...
answer: Come on. It's time..

question: I'm so scared...
answer: Don't be

question: And grateful. To you. If it weren't for you --
answer: I know. I need to speak with the Dowager Empress ...

question: I know. I need to speak with the Dowager Empress ...
answer: How much pain will you inflict on an old woman for money?!

question: Please, if you'd just listen...
answer: Remove him at once.

question: Please! Empress! It's not what you .... Anya. . . please. . . Anya, wait!
answer: Tell me it isn't true?! Tell me you didn't do this for the money!

question: No! Well, yes, but
answer: No! I thought you believed in me! It was all a lie!

question: Sir! Your rear tire is flat!
answer: Ulo! Slow down!

question: I'm not Ulo and I won't slow down. But you will listen to me!
answer: You! How dare you?! Stop this car immediately! Stop this car!

question: Please don't be afraid! I'm sorry, but there was no other way! Look at this!
answer: Anastasia's music box... She had this all these years... You could have found it...

question: Go away!
answer: Who are you, child?

question: I don't know! I don't want to hurt you...
answer: Do you remember this?

question: I remember something lost ... I'm so confused! Oh, please, just tell me if you recognize me! Do you think I could have... belonged to you ...
answer: Oh! Where did you get that?!

question: I've always had it... I came here because of this! Tell me if you recognize it! Please! It's all I have...
answer: It was hers ... my Anastasia's ... If this is part of your scheme! If you found it or stole - I don't care, I'll give you whatever you want just TELL ME THE TRUTH! PAR AWAY, LONG AGO GLOWING DEEP

question: No, no child... shush... it's all right ...
answer: A grand ball for the Princess. How very exciting. So much to do, so little time...

question: Do it somewhere else, please. Quietly.
answer: Caterers ... invitations ... saber dancers! We must have saber dancers!

question: You are going to make a beautiful princess. Lovely... What troubles you, child?
answer: Madame, your... eh... guest has arrived.

question: Thank you, Vladimir.,
answer: Anya... Anastasia... I'm sorry ... We didn't mean to hurt you ...

question: I sent for you because I owe you a debt of gratitude larger than I can ever repay
answer: No. Empress, you --

question: I want you to have the reward money - you've earned it.
answer: Empress, no! I will not take the money! I just came to tell you I was sorry...

question: Young man, I...
answer: ... and I'm going to keep my promise to stay out of your lives, forever.

question: You are the boy ...
answer: I should go

question: That last night in the palace... one boy showed us kindness and courage. You were the boy who saved our lives, weren't you? Please, is there nothing I can do to repay you?
answer: Promise me she'll have her home.

question: She does.
answer: And tell me that she's happy.

question: Oh, Dmitri.I wish that I could.
answer: I'm glad you found what you were looking for.

question: She found her home. Maybe it's time I found one too!
answer: So. You don't want to go to the coronation, eh?

question: Rasputin!
answer: I know, I know ... you thought I was dead. That's how the history books will remember me - not as the ruler of all of Russia, which I SHOULD HAVE BEEN - but as the guy who was never dead when you expected him to be.

question: What do you want?!
answer: The same thing I wanted ten years ago - all the Romonovs dead I got the others, now I have to finish up with that nuisance, Anastasia...

question: You're insane! You didn't kill the Romonovs - it was the...
answer: STOP IT! I DID SO KILL THEM! And I'm going to kill Anastasia. Look at me... Look at me! You are going to help me kill her... You are going to help me kill her... her...

question: There's no choice...
answer: Your "guest" is unable to attend.

question: Oh, Meetoo! You look miserable! Oh, Vlad - look at him!
answer: Yes, your highness.

question: Poor Meetoo!
answer: Yes, your highness.

question: Why does everyone have to act that way?
answer: You'll have to become used to it, child, if you accept the crown...

question: "If" I accept?! Of course I'm going to accept! it's what I always wanted!
answer: Is it? Is this what you want?

question: I wanted to come home, Grandmama - and I did. I came back to my home with you.
answer: You can't go back to find your home. Your home is in your heart, in the future that you make for yourself.

question: And this is my future. This is who I am!
answer: This is who you were. Exactly who you are is up to you.

question: I don't know who I am! I still don't know!
answer: Yes, you do. You do. And in your heart, you know what is right for you.

question: I've spent my whole life waiting to find you ...
answer: And we have found each other nothing will ever change that! I am your family, dear child, but I may not be your home.
